title: Static Analysis

android.permission.INTERNET.description: Allows an application to create network sockets.

android.permission.WAKE_LOCK.description: Allows an application to prevent the phone from going to sleep.

android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE.description: Allows an application to view the status of all networks.

android.permission.RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETE.description: Allows an application to start itself as soon as the system has finished booting. This can make it take longer to start the phone and allow the application to slow down the overall phone by always running.

android.permission.FOREGROUND_SERVICE.description: Allows a regular application to use Service.startForeground.

certificate_findings: Application is signed with a code signing certificate

Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android 5.0-8.0, if signed only with v1 signature scheme. Applications running on Android 5.0-7.0 signed with v1, and v2/v3 scheme is also vulnerable.

manifest_analysis.title:
Application Data can be Backed up
[android:allowBackup=true]
manifest_analysis.desc: This flag allows anyone to backup your application data via adb. It allows users who have enabled USB debugging to copy application data off of the device.
manifest_analysis.name: Application Data can be Backed up [android:allowBackup=true]

manifest_analysis.title: Launch Mode of Activity (com.unciv.app.AndroidLauncher) is not standard.
manifest_analysis.desc: An Activity should not be having the launch mode attribute set to "singleTask/singleInstance" as it becomes root Activity and it is possible for other applications to read the contents of the calling Intent. So it is required to use the "standard" launch mode attribute when sensitive information is included in an Intent.
manifest_analysis.name: Launch Mode of Activity is not standard.

manifest_analysis.title:
Service (androidx.work.impl.background.systemjob.SystemJobService) is Protected by a permission, but the protection level of the permission should be checked.
Permission: android.permission.BIND_JOB_SERVICE
[android:exported=true]
manifest_analysis.desc: A Service is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. It is protected by a permission which is not defined in the analysed application. As a result, the protection level of the permission should be checked where it is defined. If it is set to normal or dangerous, a malicious application can request and obtain the permission and interact with the component. If it is set to signature, only applications signed with the same certificate can obtain the permission.
manifest_analysis.name: is Protected by a permission, but the protection level of the permission should be checked.[android:exported=true]

nx.description: The shared object has NX bit set. This marks a memory page non-executable making attacker injected shellcode non-executable.

stack_canary.description: This shared object has a stack canary value added to the stack so that it will be overwritten by a stack buffer that overflows the return address. This allows detection of overflows by verifying the integrity of the canary before function return.

relocation_readonly.description: This shared object has full RELRO enabled. RELRO ensures that the GOT cannot be overwritten in vulnerable ELF binaries. In Full RELRO, the entire GOT (.got and .got.plt both) is marked as read-only.

rpath.description: The shared object does not have run-time search path or RPATH set.

runpath.description: The shared object does not have RUNPATH set.

fortify.description: The shared object does not have any fortified functions. Fortified functions provides buffer overflow checks against glibc's commons insecure functions like strcpy, gets etc. Use the compiler option -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 to fortify functions.

stack_canary.description: This shared object has a stack canary value added to the stack so that it will be overwritten by a stack buffer that overflows the return address. This allows detection of overflows by verifying the integrity of the canary before function return.

relocation_readonly.description: This shared object has partial RELRO enabled. RELRO ensures that the GOT cannot be overwritten in vulnerable ELF binaries. In partial RELRO, the non-PLT part of the GOT section is read only but .got.plt is still writeable. Use the option -z,relro,-z,now to enable full RELRO.

metadata.cwe: CWE-330: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
metadata.description: The App uses an insecure Random Number Generator.

metadata.cwe: CWE-532: Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File
metadata.description: The App logs information. Sensitive information should never be logged.

metadata.cwe: CWE-312: Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information
metadata.description: Files may contain hardcoded sensitive information like usernames, passwords, keys etc.
App can read/write to External Storage. Any App can read data written to External Storage.
App creates temp file. Sensitive information should never be written into a temp file.
This App copies data to clipboard. Sensitive data should not be copied to clipboard as other applications can access it.

FCS_RBG_EXT.1.1.choice: The application use no DRBG functionality for its cryptographic operations.

FCS_STO_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not store any credentials to non-volatile memory.

FCS_CKM_EXT.1.1.choice: The application generate no asymmetric cryptographic keys.

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has access to ['network connectivity'].

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.2.choice: The application has access to no sensitive information repositories.

FDP_NET_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has user/application initiated network communications.

FDP_DAR_EXT.1.1.choice: The application implement functionality to encrypt sensitive data in non-volatile memory.

FMT_MEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application invoke the mechanisms recommended by the platform vendor for storing and setting configuration options.

FTP_DIT_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does encrypt some transmitted data with HTTPS/TLS/SSH between itself and another trusted IT product.

high.title: Application vulnerable to Janus Vulnerability
high.description: Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android 5.0-8.0, if signed only with v1 signature scheme. Applications running on Android 5.0-7.0 signed with v1, and v2/v3 scheme is also vulnerable.

high.title: Launch Mode of Activity (com.unciv.app.AndroidLauncher) is not standard.
high.description: An Activity should not be having the launch mode attribute set to "singleTask/singleInstance" as it becomes root Activity and it is possible for other applications to read the contents of the calling Intent. So it is required to use the "standard" launch mode attribute when sensitive information is included in an Intent.

warning.title: Application Data can be Backed up
warning.description:
[android:allowBackup=true]
This flag allows anyone to backup your application data via adb. It allows users who have enabled USB debugging to copy application data off of the device.

warning.title: Service (androidx.work.impl.background.systemjob.SystemJobService) is Protected by a permission, but the protection level of the permission should be checked.
warning.description:
Permission: android.permission.BIND_JOB_SERVICE [android:exported=true]
A Service is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. It is protected by a permission which is not defined in the analysed application. As a result, the protection level of the permission should be checked where it is defined. If it is set to normal or dangerous, a malicious application can request and obtain the permission and interact with the component. If it is set to signature, only applications signed with the same certificate can obtain the permission.
